1â†’# Tasks: Sequence and Array Runtime Migration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-sequence-array-runtime/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: Required per Constitution Principle VII (TDD) and SC-006 (100% test coverage)
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’## Path Conventions
    17â†’
    18â†’Files modified (from plan.md):
    19â†’- `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp` - Extend with subseq-rt, adjust-array-rt
    20â†’- `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp` - Add registration, remove compile-* functions
    21â†’- `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp` - New test file
    22â†’
    23â†’---
    24â†’
    25â†’## Phase 1: Setup
    26â†’
    27â†’**Purpose**: Create test infrastructure for TDD workflow
    28â†’
    29â†’- [ ] T001 Create test file `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp` with rove test suite structure
    30â†’- [ ] T002 [P] Add HyperSpec reference comments for [subseq](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_subseq.htm) and [adjust-array](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_adjust.htm) to test file
    31â†’
    32â†’---
    33â†’
    34â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    35â†’
    36â†’**Purpose**: Ensure UTF-8 helpers and type predicates are accessible
    37â†’
    38â†’**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: US1 depends on UTF-8 helpers from string-runtime.lisp
    39â†’
    40â†’- [ ] T003 Verify `utf8-continuation-byte-p` is exported and accessible from `src/clysm/lib/string-runtime.lisp`
    41â†’- [ ] T004 [P] Verify `decode-utf8-char` is exported and accessible from `src/clysm/lib/string-runtime.lisp`
    42â†’- [ ] T005 Add helper function `char-position-to-byte-position` in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp` for UTF-8 index conversion
    43â†’
    44â†’**Checkpoint**: UTF-8 helpers verified - User Story implementation can begin
    45â†’
    46â†’---
    47â†’
    48â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Subseq on Strings with UTF-8 (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    49â†’
    50â†’**Goal**: Implement subseq-rt for UTF-8 encoded strings with character-position indices
    51â†’
    52â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(subseq "æ—¥æœ¬èª" 1)` and verify result is "æœ¬èª"
    53â†’
    54â†’### Tests for User Story 1 âš ï¸
    55â†’
    56â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    57â†’
    58â†’- [ ] T006 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-ascii` for ASCII strings in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    59â†’- [ ] T007 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-utf8-2byte` for 2-byte UTF-8 chars (Ã©, Ã±) in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    60â†’- [ ] T008 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-utf8-3byte` for 3-byte UTF-8 chars (æ—¥æœ¬èª) in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    61â†’- [ ] T009 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-utf8-4byte` for 4-byte UTF-8 chars (emoji) in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    62â†’- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-empty` for empty result (start=end) in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    63â†’- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-bounds-error` for out-of-bounds error in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    64â†’
    65â†’### Implementation for User Story 1
    66â†’
    67â†’- [ ] T012 [US1] Implement `string-subseq-rt` helper function for string subsequence with UTF-8 support in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
    68â†’- [ ] T013 [US1] Add string-specific bounds validation in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
    69â†’- [ ] T014 [US1] Run tests and verify all US1 tests pass
    70â†’
    71â†’**Checkpoint**: String subseq with UTF-8 works independently - can demo with `(subseq "cafÃ©" 0 4)`
    72â†’
    73â†’---
    74â†’
    75â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Subseq on Lists and Vectors (Priority: P1)
    76â†’
    77â†’**Goal**: Extend subseq-rt to support lists and vectors in addition to strings
    78â†’
    79â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(subseq '(a b c d) 1 3)` and verify result is `(b c)`
    80â†’
    81â†’### Tests for User Story 2 âš ï¸
    82â†’
    83â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    84â†’
    85â†’- [ ] T015 [P] [US2] Write test `test-list-subseq-basic` for list subsequence in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    86â†’- [ ] T016 [P] [US2] Write test `test-list-subseq-empty` for empty list result in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    87â†’- [ ] T017 [P] [US2] Write test `test-list-subseq-whole` for entire list in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    88â†’- [ ] T018 [P] [US2] Write test `test-vector-subseq-basic` for vector subsequence in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    89â†’- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Write test `test-vector-subseq-empty` for empty vector result in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    90â†’- [ ] T020 [P] [US2] Write test `test-subseq-type-dispatch` verifying correct type detection in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
    91â†’
    92â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
    93â†’
    94â†’- [ ] T021 [P] [US2] Implement `list-subseq-rt` helper function using nthcdr and copy in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
    95â†’- [ ] T022 [P] [US2] Implement `vector-subseq-rt` helper function using aref and make-array in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
    96â†’- [ ] T023 [US2] Implement main `subseq-rt` function with type dispatch (stringp/listp/vectorp) in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
    97â†’- [ ] T024 [US2] Run tests and verify all US1 + US2 tests pass
    98â†’
    99â†’**Checkpoint**: All sequence types work - subseq-rt is complete
   100â†’
   101â†’---
   102â†’
   103â†’## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Adjust-Array Basic Resizing (Priority: P2)
   104â†’
   105â†’**Goal**: Implement adjust-array-rt for 1D arrays with :initial-element support
   106â†’
   107â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(adjust-array #(1 2 3) 5 :initial-element 0)` and verify result is `#(1 2 3 0 0)`
   108â†’
   109â†’### Tests for User Story 3 âš ï¸
   110â†’
   111â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
   112â†’
   113â†’- [ ] T025 [P] [US3] Write test `test-adjust-array-grow` for growing array in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
   114â†’- [ ] T026 [P] [US3] Write test `test-adjust-array-shrink` for shrinking array in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
   115â†’- [ ] T027 [P] [US3] Write test `test-adjust-array-same-size` for same size in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
   116â†’- [ ] T028 [P] [US3] Write test `test-adjust-array-initial-element` for :initial-element fill in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
   117â†’- [ ] T029 [P] [US3] Write test `test-adjust-array-list-dims` for dimensions as list in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
   118â†’- [ ] T030 [P] [US3] Write test `test-adjust-array-multidim-error` for multidimensional array error in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
   119â†’
   120â†’### Implementation for User Story 3
   121â†’
   122â†’- [ ] T031 [US3] Implement `adjust-array-rt` function with dimension extraction in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
   123â†’- [ ] T032 [US3] Add element copy logic preserving existing elements in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
   124â†’- [ ] T033 [US3] Add :initial-element fill logic for new slots in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
   125â†’- [ ] T034 [US3] Add 1D array validation (error for multidimensional) in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
   126â†’- [ ] T035 [US3] Run tests and verify all US3 tests pass
   127â†’
   128â†’**Checkpoint**: adjust-array-rt complete - 1D array resizing works
   129â†’
   130â†’---
   131â†’
   132â†’## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Runtime Dispatch Integration (Priority: P2)
   133â†’
   134â†’**Goal**: Register functions in `*runtime-function-table*` and verify compiler dispatch
   135â†’
   136â†’**Independent Test**: Verify `(gethash 'subseq clysm::*runtime-function-table*)` returns `(:$subseq-rt)`
   137â†’
   138â†’### Tests for User Story 4 âš ï¸
   139â†’
   140â†’- [ ] T036 [P] [US4] Write test `test-subseq-registration` verifying runtime table entry in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
   141â†’- [ ] T037 [P] [US4] Write test `test-adjust-array-registration` verifying runtime table entry in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
   142â†’
   143â†’### Implementation for User Story 4
   144â†’
   145â†’- [ ] T038 [US4] Add `register-sequence-array-runtime-functions` function in `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp`
   146â†’- [ ] T039 [US4] Call registration function at module load time in `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp`
   147â†’- [ ] T040 [US4] Run Stage 1 compilation with `sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp`
   148â†’- [ ] T041 [US4] Validate generated Wasm with `wasm-tools validate dist/clysm-stage1.wasm`
   149â†’- [ ] T042 [US4] Run tests and verify all US4 tests pass
   150â†’
   151â†’**Checkpoint**: Runtime dispatch works - compiler uses `*runtime-function-table*` for subseq and adjust-array
   152â†’
   153â†’---
   154â†’
   155â†’## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Dead Code Removal (Priority: P3)
   156â†’
   157â†’**Goal**: Remove ~175 lines of compile-subseq and compile-adjust-array from func-section.lisp
   158â†’
   159â†’**Independent Test**: `grep -c "compile-subseq\|compile-adjust-array" src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp` returns 0
   160â†’
   161â†’### Implementation for User Story 5
   162â†’
   163â†’- [ ] T043 [US5] Remove `compile-subseq` function (~115 lines) from `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp`
   164â†’- [ ] T044 [US5] Remove `compile-adjust-array` function (~60 lines) from `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp`
   165â†’- [ ] T045 [US5] Remove any helper functions used only by removed code in `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp`
   166â†’- [ ] T046 [US5] Remove case entries for subseq and adjust-array from compile-funcall in `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp`
   167â†’- [ ] T047 [US5] Verify line count reduction (~175 lines) in `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp`
   168â†’- [ ] T048 [US5] Run full test suite with `sbcl --eval "(asdf:test-system :clysm)"`
   169â†’
   170â†’**Checkpoint**: Dead code removed - func-section.lisp is cleaner
   171â†’
   172â†’---
   173â†’
   174â†’## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   175â†’
   176â†’**Purpose**: Final validation and documentation
   177â†’
   178â†’- [ ] T049 Verify SC-001: Runtime library implementation < 300 lines
   179â†’- [ ] T050 Verify SC-002: func-section.lisp reduced by ~175 lines
   180â†’- [ ] T051 [P] Run Stage 1 compilation and Wasm validation (final verification)
   181â†’- [ ] T052 [P] Verify SC-008: No regression in existing sequence-runtime.lisp tests
   182â†’- [ ] T053 Run quickstart.md validation steps
   183â†’- [ ] T054 Update CLAUDE.md Recent Changes section with feature summary
   184â†’
   185â†’---
   186â†’
   187â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   188â†’
   189â†’### Phase Dependencies
   190â†’
   191â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   192â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup - BLOCKS all user stories
   193â†’- **US1 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - MVP for strings
   194â†’- **US2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Foundational - can parallel with US1 (different helpers)
   195â†’- **US3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on Foundational - independent of US1/US2
   196â†’- **US4 (Phase 6)**: Depends on US1, US2, US3 completion (needs all functions implemented)
   197â†’- **US5 (Phase 7)**: Depends on US4 completion (verify dispatch works before removing old code)
   198â†’- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on US5 completion
   199â†’
   200â†’### User Story Dependencies
   201â†’
   202â†’```
   203â†’Phase 1 (Setup)
   204â†’    â”‚
   205â†’    â–¼
   206â†’Phase 2 (Foundational)
   207â†’    â”‚
   208â†’    â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   209â†’    â–¼              â–¼              â–¼
   210â†’Phase 3 (US1)  Phase 4 (US2)  Phase 5 (US3)
   211â†’  Strings      Lists/Vectors    Arrays
   212â†’    â”‚              â”‚              â”‚
   213â†’    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   214â†’                   â”‚
   215â†’                   â–¼
   216â†’            Phase 6 (US4)
   217â†’            Registration
   218â†’                   â”‚
   219â†’                   â–¼
   220â†’            Phase 7 (US5)
   221â†’            Dead Code Removal
   222â†’                   â”‚
   223â†’                   â–¼
   224â†’            Phase 8 (Polish)
   225â†’```
   226â†’
   227â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   228â†’
   229â†’**Phase 3-4-5 Parallelization** (after Foundational):
   230â†’- US1 (strings), US2 (lists/vectors), US3 (arrays) can run in parallel
   231â†’- Different helper functions, no file conflicts
   232â†’- T012-T014 || T021-T024 || T031-T035
   233â†’
   234â†’**Within Each Story**:
   235â†’- All tests marked [P] can run in parallel (same file, different test functions)
   236â†’- T006-T011 (US1 tests) can all be written simultaneously
   237â†’- T015-T020 (US2 tests) can all be written simultaneously
   238â†’- T025-T030 (US3 tests) can all be written simultaneously
   239â†’
   240â†’---
   241â†’
   242â†’## Parallel Example: User Stories 1-3 After Foundational
   243â†’
   244â†’```bash
   245â†’# After Phase 2 completes, launch all three story implementations:
   246â†’
   247â†’# Stream 1: US1 - String subseq
   248â†’Task: "Write test test-string-subseq-ascii in tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp"
   249â†’Task: "Implement string-subseq-rt in src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp"
   250â†’
   251â†’# Stream 2: US2 - List/Vector subseq
   252â†’Task: "Write test test-list-subseq-basic in tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp"
   253â†’Task: "Implement list-subseq-rt in src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp"
   254â†’
   255â†’# Stream 3: US3 - Adjust-array
   256â†’Task: "Write test test-adjust-array-grow in tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp"
   257â†’Task: "Implement adjust-array-rt in src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp"
   258â†’```
   259â†’
   260â†’---
   261â†’
   262â†’## Implementation Strategy
   263â†’
   264â†’### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)
   265â†’
   266â†’1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
   267â†’2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational
   268â†’3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (String subseq with UTF-8)
   269â†’4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test `(subseq "æ—¥æœ¬èª" 1)` independently
   270â†’5. Can demo UTF-8 string handling at this point
   271â†’
   272â†’### Incremental Delivery
   273â†’
   274â†’1. Setup + Foundational â†’ Infrastructure ready
   275â†’2. US1 (strings) â†’ UTF-8 subseq works â†’ Demo
   276â†’3. US2 (lists/vectors) â†’ Full subseq-rt complete â†’ Demo
   277â†’4. US3 (adjust-array) â†’ adjust-array-rt complete â†’ Demo
   278â†’5. US4 (registration) â†’ Compiler integration verified
   279â†’6. US5 (cleanup) â†’ Dead code removed, feature complete
   280â†’
   281â†’---
   282â†’
   283â†’## Notes
   284â†’
   285â†’- [P] tasks = different files or independent test functions, no dependencies
   286â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   287â†’- TDD workflow: Write tests first, verify they fail, then implement
   288â†’- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
   289â†’- Commit after each task or logical group
   290â†’- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
   291â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: Sequence and Array Runtime Migration

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-sequence-array-runtime/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: Required per Constitution Principle VII (TDD) and SC-006 (100% test coverage)

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## Path Conventions

Files modified (from plan.md):
- `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp` - Extend with subseq-rt, adjust-array-rt
- `src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp` - Add registration, remove compile-* functions
- `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp` - New test file

---

## Phase 1: Setup

**Purpose**: Create test infrastructure for TDD workflow

- [ ] T001 Create test file `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp` with rove test suite structure
- [ ] T002 [P] Add HyperSpec reference comments for [subseq](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_subseq.htm) and [adjust-array](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_adjust.htm) to test file

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Ensure UTF-8 helpers and type predicates are accessible

**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: US1 depends on UTF-8 helpers from string-runtime.lisp

- [ ] T003 Verify `utf8-continuation-byte-p` is exported and accessible from `src/clysm/lib/string-runtime.lisp`
- [ ] T004 [P] Verify `decode-utf8-char` is exported and accessible from `src/clysm/lib/string-runtime.lisp`
- [ ] T005 Add helper function `char-position-to-byte-position` in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp` for UTF-8 index conversion

**Checkpoint**: UTF-8 helpers verified - User Story implementation can begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Subseq on Strings with UTF-8 (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: Implement subseq-rt for UTF-8 encoded strings with character-position indices

**Independent Test**: Compile `(subseq "æ—¥æœ¬èª" 1)` and verify result is "æœ¬èª"

### Tests for User Story 1 âš ï¸

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T006 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-ascii` for ASCII strings in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T007 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-utf8-2byte` for 2-byte UTF-8 chars (Ã©, Ã±) in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T008 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-utf8-3byte` for 3-byte UTF-8 chars (æ—¥æœ¬èª) in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T009 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-utf8-4byte` for 4-byte UTF-8 chars (emoji) in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-empty` for empty result (start=end) in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Write test `test-string-subseq-bounds-error` for out-of-bounds error in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T012 [US1] Implement `string-subseq-rt` helper function for string subsequence with UTF-8 support in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
- [ ] T013 [US1] Add string-specific bounds validation in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
- [ ] T014 [US1] Run tests and verify all US1 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: String subseq with UTF-8 works independently - can demo with `(subseq "cafÃ©" 0 4)`

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Subseq on Lists and Vectors (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Extend subseq-rt to support lists and vectors in addition to strings

**Independent Test**: Compile `(subseq '(a b c d) 1 3)` and verify result is `(b c)`

### Tests for User Story 2 âš ï¸

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T015 [P] [US2] Write test `test-list-subseq-basic` for list subsequence in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T016 [P] [US2] Write test `test-list-subseq-empty` for empty list result in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T017 [P] [US2] Write test `test-list-subseq-whole` for entire list in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T018 [P] [US2] Write test `test-vector-subseq-basic` for vector subsequence in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Write test `test-vector-subseq-empty` for empty vector result in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T020 [P] [US2] Write test `test-subseq-type-dispatch` verifying correct type detection in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T021 [P] [US2] Implement `list-subseq-rt` helper function using nthcdr and copy in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
- [ ] T022 [P] [US2] Implement `vector-subseq-rt` helper function using aref and make-array in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`
- [ ] T023 [US2] Implement main `subseq-rt` function with type dispatch (stringp/listp/vectorp) in `src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp`

## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Adjust-Array Basic Resizing (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement adjust-array-rt for 1D arrays with :initial-element support

**Independent Test**: Compile `(adjust-array #(1 2 3) 5 :initial-element 0)` and verify result is `#(1 2 3 0 0)`

- [ ] T028 [P] [US3] Write test `test-adjust-array-initial-element` for :initial-element fill in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`
- [ ] T029 [P] [US3] Write test `test-adjust-array-list-dims` for dimensions as list in `tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp`

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup - BLOCKS all user stories
- **US1 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - MVP for strings
- **US2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Foundational - can parallel with US1 (different helpers)
- **US3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on Foundational - independent of US1/US2
- **US4 (Phase 6)**: Depends on US1, US2, US3 completion (needs all functions implemented)
- **US5 (Phase 7)**: Depends on US4 completion (verify dispatch works before removing old code)
- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on US5 completion

### User Story Dependencies

```

    â”‚
    â–¼
Phase 2 (Foundational)
    â”‚
    â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    â–¼              â–¼              â–¼
Phase 3 (US1)  Phase 4 (US2)  Phase 5 (US3)
  Strings      Lists/Vectors    Arrays
    â”‚              â”‚              â”‚
    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

```

### Parallel Opportunities

**Phase 3-4-5 Parallelization** (after Foundational):
- US1 (strings), US2 (lists/vectors), US3 (arrays) can run in parallel
- Different helper functions, no file conflicts
- T012-T014 || T021-T024 || T031-T035

**Within Each Story**:
- All tests marked [P] can run in parallel (same file, different test functions)
- T006-T011 (US1 tests) can all be written simultaneously
- T015-T020 (US2 tests) can all be written simultaneously
- T025-T030 (US3 tests) can all be written simultaneously

---

## Parallel Example: User Stories 1-3 After Foundational

```bash
# After Phase 2 completes, launch all three story implementations:

# Stream 1: US1 - String subseq
Task: "Write test test-string-subseq-ascii in tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp"
Task: "Implement string-subseq-rt in src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp"

# Stream 2: US2 - List/Vector subseq
Task: "Write test test-list-subseq-basic in tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp"
Task: "Implement list-subseq-rt in src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp"

# Stream 3: US3 - Adjust-array
Task: "Write test test-adjust-array-grow in tests/unit/sequence-array-runtime-test.lisp"
Task: "Implement adjust-array-rt in src/clysm/lib/sequence-runtime.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (String subseq with UTF-8)
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test `(subseq "æ—¥æœ¬èª" 1)` independently
5. Can demo UTF-8 string handling at this point

### Incremental Delivery

1. Setup + Foundational â†’ Infrastructure ready
2. US1 (strings) â†’ UTF-8 subseq works â†’ Demo
3. US2 (lists/vectors) â†’ Full subseq-rt complete â†’ Demo
4. US3 (adjust-array) â†’ adjust-array-rt complete â†’ Demo
5. US4 (registration) â†’ Compiler integration verified
6. US5 (cleanup) â†’ Dead code removed, feature complete

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files or independent test functions, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- TDD workflow: Write tests first, verify they fail, then implement
- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
